administrative/homebrew/bleeding-out.htm.title: Bleeding Out
administrative/homebrew/bleeding-out.htm.description:
When your character's HP falls to 0 and is not instantly dead, instead of becoming unconscious, they begin Bleeding Out. At the start of your next turn, you begin rolling death saves and marking Successes and Failures (a 20 counts as 3 Successes and a 1 counts as 2 Failures). You then get to use one (1) of the following: Your Movement, your Action, or your Bonus Action. Finally, pick an option from the following list.
Bandage Yourself: Roll a second Death Save. If it is a failure, discard it. If it is a success, mark it down.
Distract the Enemy: Give an adversary (within line of sight) Disadvantage on their next d20 Test.
Rally Through Pain: Give another player (within line of sight) Advantage on their next d20 Test.
Death Frenzy: Use another Movement, Action, or Bonus Action

administrative/homebrew/crafting.html.title: Crafting
administrative/homebrew/crafting.html.description: Miinstrel's Complete Crafting

administrative/homebrew/downtime-jobs.ht.title: Downtime Jobs
administrative/homebrew/downtime-jobs.ht.description:
A Downtime Job is a way to allow players to work on any long-term projects.When a player starts a Downtime Job, the DM works with the players to set:
a Prerequisite,
an advantage for completing the job (if it's not obvious),
a DC,
a Time to Finish (TtF),
a cost,
and whether you can work on the job while traveling.
When the player spends eight consecutive hours on a job, they can roll a check for a relevant skill using the job's DC. If they succeed, they make a breakthrough, finishing another 8hr on the project (for a total of 16hr).If you can work on the job while traveling, you make half the amount of progress you would make while you are on the move.Job: Writie History of Town County
Prerequisite: A bookYou write the History of Town County. When you have that book with you: you have Advantage on history checks related to Town County.DC: 15
TtF: 40hr
Cost: N/A
Travel: No

administrative/homebrew/enhanced-critica.title: Enhanced Critical Hits
administrative/homebrew/enhanced-critica.description: When you make a Critical Hit on an enemy, you roll your dice and add your modifiers normally. Then, look at your damage dice, and add the max amount of damage that dice could roll.If you make a Critical Hit with a Dagger (1d4), and you have +3 to damage, then you would roll the d4, add 3, and then add 4 extra damage (since the max amount of damage a d4 can roll is a 4). Let's say you roll a 2. Your final damage is then 9 (2+3+4).If you made a Critical Hit with a Maul (2d6) and have +4 to damage, you would roll 2d6 (let's say you roll a 4 and a 3 for a total of 7), then you add +4 (7+4=11), then add 12 (6+6), for a total of 23 (11+12).

administrative/homebrew/excursion-rest.h.title: Excursion Rest
administrative/homebrew/excursion-rest.h.description:
With Excursion Rest, a short rest takes 8hr: 6hr of which must be spent sleeping, 2hr of which can be spent doing light activity.A short rest is broken by:
Rolling Initiative
Casting a Spell w/ a Spell Slot
Taking Any Damage
A long rest can be achieved after spending three nights in the same location without having the rest be broken.

administrative/homebrew/hexcrawl-rules.h.title: Hexcrawl Rules
administrative/homebrew/hexcrawl-rules.h.description:
Each Hex is 3 miles long. Depending on the Hex, the time it takes varies:
Road - 1hr
Plains or Hills - 2hr
Bog or Forest - 4hr
Mountains - 8hr
Depending on the type of Hex, you will be able to see into surrounding hexes
Normal Hexes - 1 Hex Out
Hills/Towers - 2 Hexes Out
Mountains - 3 Hexes Out
There is also a chance for a random encounter to happen when entering a Hex.Searching a Hex takes as long as it does to enter. Upon searching a hex, you can find the following:
a number of rations
some bunches of alchemical herbs
a clue as to what's nearby
potential secrets
or something else

administrative/homebrew/potion-quaffing..title: Potion Quaffing
administrative/homebrew/potion-quaffing..description: When you drink a potion or administer it to a party member, you may use your Action or you may use a Bonus Action. If you use your Action, you gain the max amount of healing the potion affords.If you use your Bonus Action, you roll the potion's dice roll to determine how much HP you gain.

administrative/homebrew/scaled-misses.ht.title: Scaled Misses
administrative/homebrew/scaled-misses.ht.description: When a player misses an Attack Roll by 5 or less, the enemy takes half damage.If they miss by 10 or less, the enemy takes half the player's damage modifier.

administrative/homebrew/simplified-xp.ht.title: Simplified XP
administrative/homebrew/simplified-xp.ht.description:
Gain XP through exploration, social, and combat encounters. The amount of XP varies based on the difficulty of the encounter.Level 3 takes 20XP to Level Up
Levels 4 through 11 take 30XP to Level Up
Levels 12-20 take 20XP to Level Up

administrative/overview-pages/geography-.title: Geography and Politics
administrative/overview-pages/geography-.description:
(Back to Introduction)
The land of Morshir is filled with plains and rivers and mountain ranges.
It is divided into four countries, the three that make up the Erkad Alliance -- Ermron, Durian, and Krenic -- as well as the island nation of Surane. A fifth entity, the Talon Order, is a group of druids who operate within the Erkad Alliance but are not governed by it.These countries are also further divided into regions:
Regions of Ermron
West Ermron
The Cardinal Hills (Northern + Southern Hills)
Lefra's Grove
East Ermron (Barrier Peaks + Funnelwood)
Central Plains
The West Coast (Fishtail Peninsula + West Coasts of Ermron and Krenic)
Regions of Durian
Durian Plains (Durian Plains + Dragonclaw Ridge + Chilnola Rise)
Morrain's Spine
Grenort Forest
Regions of Krenic
East Krenic (West Bordergrove + Kalma Range + Littlewood)
The Empty Peaks (East Bordergrove + The Empty Peaks)
Deprest Woods
Saria (Saria + Inner Coast of Krenic)
The West Coast (Fishtail Peninsula + West Coasts of Ermron and Krenic)
Surane (region)
Morshir is also surrounded by the four Elemental Plains where life began.

administrative/overview-pages/history-an.title: History and Legend
administrative/overview-pages/history-an.description:
(Back to Introduction)
The land of Morshir has a storied history from The Shaping of the World to the rise of The Erkad Alliance and it's fall during The Shattering.This index seeks to catalog the texts I have discovered in my travels, as well as those I have attempted to recount myself.
The Shaping
The First Spring
The War of the Spine

headers.heading: The Shaping and The First Spring

administrative/overview-pages/religion-a.title: Religion and Deities
administrative/overview-pages/religion-a.description:
(Back to Introduction)
Religion in Morshir revolves around the four Great Dragons -- Soarkos, Shenlo, Firoas, and Morrain -- and their children the Dragons.

administrative/overview-pages/species-an.title: Species and Culture
administrative/overview-pages/species-an.description:
(Back to Introduction)
The peoples of Morshir are vast and varried, but they are often categorized into four types due to origin and appearance. These categories are:
Beastfolk, species that resemble common animals, such as fawns and ribbets
Birdfolk, species that resemble the birds of the sky, sich as aarakocra and owlins
Dragonfolk, species that resemble or are descendants of the great dragons of the Elemental Plains, such as dragonborn and kobolds
Novelfolk, species that do not resemble anything that otherwise exists in the world, such as humans and elves There are also many distinct cultures, all based on geographic location. These cultures are:
West Ermron
The Cardinal Hills (Northern + Southern Hills)
Lefra's Grove
East Ermron (Barrier Peaks + Funnelwood)
Central Plains
The West Coast (Fishtail Peninsula + West Coasts of Ermron and Krenic)
Durian Plains (Durian Plains + Dragonclaw Ridge + Chilnola Rise)
Morrain's Spine
Grenort Forest
East Krenic (West Bordergrove + Kalma Range + Littlewood)
The Empty Peaks (East Bordergrove + The Empty Peaks)
Deprest Woods
Saria (Saria + Inner Coast of Krenic)
Surane
An important part of the broader culture of Morshir are the technologies and magics invented and discovered by the people here. Refer to the Index of Social Artifacts for more information.

administrative/class-guide.html.title: Class Guide
administrative/class-guide.html.description:
Dear Players,While the classes available to you will differ drastically depending on which TTRPG system we choose to play, there are a few guidelines I believe I can leave you with.All purely martial characters will be from some corner of the Erkad Alliance. If you are interested in formal military/fighting training for your character, look up Mirikk Military Academy in Ayrith. Otherwise, check out the countries of the Erkad Alliance and the various regions within to pick out where you think your character is from.
Most types of casters will be from some corner of the Erkad Alliance. There are however, two major exceptions: nature-based casters and knowledge-based casters.
Those who are able to manipulate nature or gain mostly nature-based spells could have been inducted into the Talon Order, an order of druids who protect the natural world of Morshir. Full-casters, half-casters, nature-based subclasses, or anyone with access nature-based spells due to feats or species could be written to be in the Talon Order.
Those who gain their magic purely through study and hard work learned their magic at the Academy Surane, and upon graduation, became citizens of Surane. Full-casters, half-casters, arcane subclasses, or anyone with a relevant feat could be written to have gone to the Academy Surane. Divine magic, Inherited magic, and Pact magic are all strictly excluded.Sincerely, Your GM

administrative/foreword.html.title: Foreword
administrative/foreword.html.description: In the wake of the Shattering, many of the exhaustive records of Morshirits people and its historyhave become lost to the tides.Due to this immense loss, I have dedicated these past years to seeking out any and all surviving documents, as well as writing and commissioning many, many more. While this Encyclopedia is in no way complete (as it may never be), I hope it satisfies at least some of your curiosity, Polyesfera. I will continue to send you more pages as they are written. Perhaps one day, this tome will be greater than the ones we have lost. Simeon Wilford< | >

administrative/front-page.html.title: Front Page
administrative/front-page.html.description: | >

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: Erkad Alliance
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
Above: Map of the Erkad Alliance
The Erkad Alliance was the hard won union of three separate nations on Morshir: Ermron, Durian, and Krenic. They formed a federal government hosted in the center of the continent in a capital city they called Erkad. This Alliance has lasted longer than anyone has been alive.
The federal government in Erkad is run by the Council of Lords, who are responsible for decisions regarding the whole Alliance, while more local decisions are up to each nation. They also run the National Guard as a continental military, while each nation also has their own smaller guard forces.
See: Regions of Ermron Ermron is an industrious country that is always moving forward. It is the seat of entertainment, political squabbling, and capitalism on the continent.
See: Regions of Durian Durian is an agrarian country, content to farm and work for the benefit of their close neighbors. It is the seat of most raw productions as well as art on the continent.
See: Regions of Krenic Krenic is a militaristic county, obsessed with rank, fitness, and chain of command. It is the seat of military might on the continentThe Council of Lords is the govenring body made up of the various lords, nobles, and kings which rule the three countries of the Alliance.The National Guard is the main military body of the Alliance which patrols and assists the individual countries' guard force.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Factions of Morshir (pre-shattering)/Erkad Alliance.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: Surane
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
See also: Surane (region)
Surane is the magical island nation to the southwest of the Erkad Alliance. It was founded by the tieflings when they left the Elemental Plain of Fire. They were obsessed with discovering the secrets of magic, and so they started an academy on the island they arrived on.
Today, the Acadmy Surane is the foremost magical academy in all of Morshir. The knowledge it holds is a closely guarded secret, only revealed to those who are dedicated to learning them.
Once a student graduates, they are granted citizenship to Surane and given access to any and all of the towers Surane owns around Morshir. These wizards go about researching magic in the wild and meddling in the affairs of those who live in the Erkad Alliance.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Factions of Morshir (pre-shattering)/Surane.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: Talon Order
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
The Talon Order is the order of druids who live on Morshir. They live in the wild, individually or in groups, and tend to nature and a number of shrines left by the Great Dragons.
While a separate entity than the Erkad Alliance, the Talon Order lives within its borders and is the voice of nature to those in the Alliance.
While no one in the Erkad Alliance is quite sure how someone becomes a durid of the Talon Order, our best theory is that random folk are born druids, but they don't awaken to their power until they reach a certain age. At that point, the Talon Order becomes aware of them and induct then into the Order proper, training them in the wild.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Factions of Morshir (pre-shattering)/Talon Order.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: Durian Plains
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
The Durian Plains is a region in Durian that runs the length of the country between Morrain's Spine and the Inner Sea.
This region encompasses most of Durian, including the main plains as well as Dragonclaw Ridge and Chilnola Rise. The main plains are a gently rolling hills that make for great farm land.
Durian's capital Tembor and its Kingland Center for the Arts is located in these Plains, as well as a few Surane towers. Due to the large size of the region, civilization is isolated to mostly small farming towns and villages, and the further from a town you go, the more like the chance of wild animals.The people of the Durian Plains tend to be simple, honest folk. Most like agrarian lives in small communities. They often love to trade with those from further away, preferring favors and textiles over gold.Folk from Durian Plains are often of firm builds, as most live on farms or do some kind of menial labor.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/Regions of Durian/Durian Plains.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: Grenort Forest
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description: Grenort Forest is a region in Durian that holds the forest it's named after.This region is dominated by the forest, as well as a little bit of border land.We are unaware of the legitimacy or location of any landmarks rumored to be within the forest are hard pressed to find a good reason to venture within.A community of vagabonds and thieves, the folk here believe that skill and might makes right. Folk roam in communal bands, but they are not free of infighting.Folk from Grenort Forest are often sturdy and rough, if not malnourished.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/Regions of Durian/Grenort Forest.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: Morrain's Spine
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
Morrain's Spine is a region in Durian that covers the large mountain range of the same name.The main geographical feature is the long mountain range and the mines underneath.No large landmarks beyond the various trading towns at the mines entrances.
The folk under the mountains are very communal and focused on ancestries, especially if you are descendants of the dwarves and orcs that banded together to fight the hobgoblins out of the mountains during The War of the Spine. They are very marxist.Folk from Morrain's Spine are often strong and sturdy.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/Regions of Durian/Morrain's Spine.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: Regions of Durian
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
(Back to The Erkad Alliance) | (Back to Cultures)The Regions of Durian are:
Durian Plains (Durian Plains + Dragonclaw Ridge + Chilnola Rise)
Morrain's Spine
Grenort Forest
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/Regions of Durian/Regions of Durian.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: Cardinal Hills
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
The Cardinal Hills is a region in Ermron enveloping the Northern and Southern Hills. Despite the miles between the two, they have similar cultures due to their status as labor mines, where people are sent to pay off extreme debt.
The main geographical features are two mountain ranges in the west of Ermron, the Northern Hills and the Southern Hills. Most people in this region live inside the mountains themselves, in towns carved into the rock.
There are a few market towns near the entrances to the labor mines, as well as a Surane tower near the Southern Hills
The Cardinal Hills, in stark contrast to the rest of Ermron, is a very collectivist region. The harsh conditions inside the hills have forged most of prisoners together, as any setback or outburst brings heavy punishment upon all. They value order, knowing that any shread of chaos has to be carefully planned and meticulously executed.Folk from the Cardinal Hills are often of solid build, having been forged in the mines.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/Regions of Ermron/Cardinal Hills.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: Central Plains
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
The Central Plains is a region in Ermron that stretches from the country's west coast to the Barrier Peaks. Home to Ermron's capital, the Plains are fertile ground for political ambition.A mostly flat region with some rolling hills, the Central Plains are home to lots of rivers, lakes, and small farms.
The capital of Ermron, The Grand City Eron, is in the Central Plains, as well as Wishbone Lake. The Grand City also holds the Grand Auditorium, where many from all over Morshir flock to see various plays and performances.The Central Plains is stuffed full of political ambition. As most of the population lives in Eron, everyone is trying to climb the ladder. Quid pro quo is king, and very few will do anything out of charity. People know what they want, and will often do anything to get it.Folk from Central Plains very a lot, as the city calls for many types of people. Some are slender and graceful. Others, such as bodyguards, are muscular and strong. And others have grown fat on the wealth and power.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/Regions of Ermron/Central Plains.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: East Ermron
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
East Ermron is a region in Ermron that covers the Barrier Peaks and everything east of them, up to the border with Durian.This region is geographically diverse, with some plains, the Barrier Peaks, and Funnelwood.
This region includes Wilfort's Pass, a strategically located trading city that has become a major city on Morshir. There is also a Surane tower in the area near Funnelwood.East Ermron is a region filled with industry and opportunity, as well as people who would take advantage of it. Capital is king, and if you're not gaming the system to make the big bucks, you're doing something wrong.Folk from East Ermron are diverse in their physical builds. The folk who work for the mines or logging operations are often of strong build, while the business owners can be more or less healthy.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/Regions of Ermron/East Ermron.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: Lefra's Grove
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
Lefra's Grove is a region in Ermron covering the small forest in the north of the country.The main geographical feature of this region is the forest.
There is rumored to be a large shrine of the Talon Order, but it's location and existence is unconfirmed.Lefta's Grove is filled with very friendly, whimsical, and curious folk. They are often interest in have fun and causing small mischief.Folk from Lefra's Grove very from plump to petite.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/Regions of Ermron/Lefra's Grove.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: Regions of Ermron
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
(Back to The Erkad Alliance) | (Back to Cultures)The Regions of Ermron are:
West Ermron
The Cardinal Hills (Northern + Southern Hills)
Lefra's Grove
East Ermron (Barrier Peaks + Funnelwood)
Central Plains
The West Coast (Fishtail Peninsula + West Coasts of Ermron and Krenic)
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/Regions of Ermron/Regions of Ermron.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: West Ermron
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
West Ermron is a region on the island to the west of Ermron.The island boasts a small mountain range (the Western Hills), some foothills, and a forest (Tresswood), along with some plains and grasslands.
The city of Tress can be found on the island, as well as a Surane tower.
West Ermron values individualism over all else. They highly value personal freedoms, to the point that they have tried to establish a separate nation from Ermron on several occasions. They are also very isolationist.Folk from West Ermron are often fit and of sturdy builds.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/Regions of Ermron/West Ermron.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: Deprest Woods
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
Deprest Woods is a region in Krenic that covers the forest it is named after.The region is dominated by the forest, as well as the two rivers that flow through it.The main landmark inside the woods in the town of Riverwood.
As a part of the highly militaristic Krenic, the people of the Deprest Woods believe in order and discipline. Everyone has their job to do. They are also isolationist, as they distrust anyone not from the woods, unless they have orders from the Krenic High Command.Folk from Deprest Woods are often lean and are taught to have good balance and stamina.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/Regions of Krenic/Deprest Woods.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: East Krenic
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
East Krenic is a region in Krenic that slots in between Deprest Woods and the Empty Peaks.East Krenic is another diverse region covering foothills, mountains and forests. The main geographical features are the Calma Range, Littlewood, and the Bordergrove.
The main landmark of the region is the city Ayrith, the cultural center of Krenic and where the famed Mirikk Military Academy. The region is also home to a Surane tower near Deprest Woods.
Aside from Ayrith, whose values cling closer to Saria, East Krenic believes strongly in hospitality. They live very comminal lives, where everyone has their place. They believe in the power of home and hearth and are very welcoming and open to anyone who passes by.Folk from East Krenic, aside from Ayrith, are often plump, though still decently strong.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/Regions of Krenic/East Krenic.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: Empty Peaks, The
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
The Empty Peaks is a region in Krenic that covers the titular Peaks and the surrounding plains.The region is dominated by the jagged, imposing mountains of the Empty Peaks.
Aside from the Surane tower, there are no significant landmarks, only a few frontier towns to speak of.Due to the bitter conditions of the mountains and the land around, the folk here are a very strict and harsh people. It's often a choice between enforcing the rules or dying.Folk from Empty Peaks, The are often rugged and of sturdy disposition.Harsh. Bitter conditions. Strict. Rules or Die. Hard.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/Regions of Krenic/Empty Peaks, The.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: Regions of Krenic
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
(Back to The Erkad Alliance) | (Back to Cultures)The Regions of Krenic are:
East Krenic (West Bordergrove + Kalma Range + Littlewood)
The Empty Peaks (East Bordergrove + The Empty Peaks)
Deprest Woods
Saria (Saria + Inner Coast of Krenic)
The West Coast (Fishtail Peninsula + West Coasts of Ermron and Krenic)
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/Regions of Krenic/Regions of Krenic.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: Saria (region)
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
Saria is a region in Krenic that holds the fortress Saria and the surrounding mountains and plains.Saria is a varied region, with the mountains of The Keep, the large lake to the south, and some of the surrounding plains.
Saria is named after the fortress capital of Krenic, as well as a Surane tower.
As the capital region of the highly militaristic Krenic, Saria is a very proud and lawful region, strict and disciplined. Everyone has their proper place and job to doFolk from Saria (region) are often of athletic build, due to the constant training regimen.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/Regions of Krenic/Saria (region).md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: Surane (region)
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
Surane is a region and a country all of its own, on an island in the southwest of Morshir.Surane is an grassland island with some foothills and a small mountain range known as Surane's Wall.
The main landmark is the Academy Surane, the premier magic school and capital city that the region's name comes from. This academy is also magically linked to the various Surane towers across Morshir, though how they works is a closely guarded secret.
Born when the tiefling's first arrived in Morshir, Surane is welcome to all who would study and learn the magic arts. However, it is very secretive. Those who are not students of the arcane are not allowed on the island's shores.Folk from Surane (region) are often fairly delicate, but the wizards and bards come in all shapes and sizes.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/Surane (region).md

geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.title: West Coast
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.description:
The West Coast is a region spanning the Fishtail Peninsula in Ermron and the west coast of Krenic.This region mostly consists of grasslands and coasts.The main landmark is Councilwatch, the town that sits at the entrance to the Dragonclaw Sea.
The West Coast is a simpler region. Many throughout Morshir would call it backwater, but the people believe in doing an honest days work, and being pleasant and happy while doing it.Folk from West Coast are often fairly robust and plump.
geography-and-politics/morshir/pre-shatt.sourcePath: Geography and Politics/Morshir/Pre-Shattering/Regions of Morshir/West Coast.md

geography-and-politics/morshir/elemental.title: Elemental Plains
geography-and-politics/morshir/elemental.description:
The Elemental Plains were the first worlds and the birthplace of the Great Dragons that created Morshir and many of the species that now populate it. The Plains are still populated with many creatures, and some doors to the Plains still exist in the deep places of Morshir.The Elemental Plain of Earth, also known as the Faewild, is a large forest with three large moons that light the whole land in constant illumination.The Elemental Plain of Water, also known as the Evertide, is an endless ocean with underwater cities and islands of hard, floating seaweed.The Elemental Plain of Air, also known as the Cloudway, is a vast expanse of air and floating islands made of luminescent clouds.The Elemental Plain of Fire, also known as the Underdark, is a complex underground cave system filled with shiny gems and lava streams.
Between the plains, there is a vast, empty darkness. Nobody knows what lies in that silent shadow, but the boarder between this darkness and Morshir is a place of death, full of shades, known as the Shadowfell.

geography-and-politics/morshir/morshir.h.title: Morshir
geography-and-politics/morshir/morshir.h.description:
Morshir is the name for the world we live on. It was created by the Great Dragons during The Shaping.
Before The Shattering, it was home to three main political entities: The Erkad Alliance (itself a union of three smaller countries), The Talon Order, and Surane.

history-and-legend/the-first-spring.html.title: The First Spring
history-and-legend/the-first-spring.html.description: The First Spring refers to the historical period of time right after The Shaping, and includes many early events and conflicts. Some people also refer to this time as The First Age, since the period lasted several decades.

history-and-legend/the-shaping.html.title: The Shaping
history-and-legend/the-shaping.html.description:
Shenlo, then, of water and seas, gave shape to the world, filling it with its own and defining its borders. Evic's Chrysalis of Fate (1.4) The Shaping of the World refers to the historical and mythological creation of Morshir by the four Great Dragons.[1] It is referenced and explained in many ancient texts, the most detailed of which comes from Evic's Chrysalis of Fate.
During a time of peace for the Elemental Plains, the four Great Dragons, then only princes of their respective Plains, came together to create the world. Soarkos carved space out of the Shadow for Morshir to be, Shenlo created the ocean, Firoas created the land, sun, and stars, and Morrain filled the world with plants. They then spawned "children," which became the Dragons of the world. Lastly, Soarkos created humanity,[2] before they returned to their homes to watch Morshir. Before Morshir was even a twinkle in the eye of the Great Dragons, the Elemental Plains were. Ruled by beings beyond our wildest dreams, the Plains saw eras of war and eras of peace. Peace it was when four princes of the Plains agreed to come together and create. Soarkos, first, of air and sky, pushed back the yawning deep that filled the space between, to make room for that which others would make next. Shenlo, then, of water and seas, gave shape to the world, filling it with her own and defining its borders. Firoas, next, of fire and stone, carved the land that all would walk and live, before ascending to keep watch, his Eye bringing light to all below. Morrain, last, of earth and tree, spread his mind over all the land, bringing green things to sprout and grow. And as the world finished it's creation, the Great Dragons gave it guardians. Soarkos birthed the Four Winds. Firoas birthed the Stars. And Morrain birthed the dragons of the hills and rivers, the forests and fields. And when the Four had finished their work, peoples came from the Elemental Plains to populate this new world. But Soarkos decided that this world needed a people of its own, and so created the humans. Then, the Great Dragons departed back to their Plains, to watch over this new world, and see what became of it. And so began, the First Spring. Evic's Chrysalis of Fate (1.2-9)
While the how of the Great Dragons' act of creation as depicted in 'Chrysalis' is mostly poetic and probably non-literal, most scholars agree that it accurately describes why they did it and who contributed what
While all the other species trace their origin back to the Elemental Plains, humanity has no clear origin. No one knows how or why Evic claims what he does, other than it seemed to be common knowledge when he was alive.

history-and-legend/the-war-of-the-spine..title: The War of the Spine
history-and-legend/the-war-of-the-spine..description:
The War of the Spine refers to the ancient conflict between dwarves, orcs, and hobgoblins in the caves under Morrain's Spine during The First Spring.
Clans of these three species all ended up under Morrain's Spine during their migration from the Elemental Plains and fought for control of the territory.
Eventually, the dwarves and orcs formed an alliance against the hobgoblins and drove them out into Grenort Forest.
history-and-legend/the-war-of-the-spine..sourcePath: History and Legend/The War of the Spine.md

religion-and-deities/dragons.html.title: Dragons
religion-and-deities/dragons.html.description:
The Dragons of Morshir are children of the Great Dragons and govern specific aspects of the natural world.
Most of the dragons on Morshir look after and embody specific things in the world: a tree or a river or some other natural thing. All of these were born to Morrain.
The Four Winds were born to Soarkos and govern all the winds that blow through the world. They are Dedri - the North Wind, proud, stubborn, cold, and harsh Visera - the East Wind, warmth, heat, judgement, and drought Usa - the South Wind, storms, rain, and passion Korade - the West Wind, calm, gentle, and spring
The Stars were born to Firoas and watch over the world.

religion-and-deities/great-dragons.html.title: Great Dragons
religion-and-deities/great-dragons.html.description:
The Great Dragons are the main deities of Morshir, having created the plain during The Shaping.
Soarkos is a prince of the Elemental Plain of Air and created the sky, the four winds, and humans. He is often seen as the greatest of the four Great Dragons, especially among humanity.
Shenlo is a prince of the Elemental Plain of Water and created the oceans and seas. She is popular among fishermen and sailors.
Firoas is a prince of the Elemental Plain of Fire and created the stone foundation of Morshir, as well as the sun, the stars, and the moon. She is often seen as the Mother of Magic, having brought it to Morshir, and is popular with the wizards of Surane.
Morrain is a prince of the Elemental Plain of Earth and created all plant life on Morshir. He is also the father of most of the Dragons that reside on Morshir.

species-and-culture/species/beastfolk.ht.title: Beastfolk
species-and-culture/species/beastfolk.ht.description:
Beastfolk refers to a category of sophont species that have some relation -- whether in origin or appearance -- to the common animals that crawl upon the grounds of the Elemental Plains and Morshir.
Faeries are insectlike folk that originate in the Plain of Earth.
Firbolg are bovinelike folk that originate in the Plain of Earth. They can appear close to cows, bison, or goats.
Fungril are mushroomlike folk that originate in the Plain of Earth.
Galapa are turtlelike folk that originate in the Plain of Water.
Goblins are mouselike folk that originate in the Plain of Earth. They often have symbiotic relationships with Hobgoblins and Simiah.
Hobgoblins are tigerlike folk that originate in the Plain of Fire. They often have symbiotic relationships with Goblins and Simiah.
Katari are catlike folk that originate in the Plain of Earth. They can appear as folklike cats or as folk with cat like ears and a tail.
Orcs are boarlike folk that originate in the Plain of Fire.
Ribbits are amphibianlike folk that originate in the Plain of Water.
Simiah are apelike folk that originate in the Plain of Earth. They often have symbiotic relationships with Goblins and Hobgoblins.

species-and-culture/species/birdfolk.htm.title: Birdfolk
species-and-culture/species/birdfolk.htm.description:
Birdfolk refers to a category of sophont species that have some relation -- whether in origin or appearance -- to the common birds that fly through the skies of Morshir and the Plain of Air.
Aarakocra are avianlike folk that originate in the Plain of Air. They often appear as eagles or hawks and prefer to live near plains and mountains.
Kenku are crowlike folk that originate in the Plain of Air. They were cursed by Soarkos before The Shaping, causing them to lose their wings. They are known for their ability to mimic speech.
Owlin are owllike folk that originate in the Plain of Air. They prefer to live near forests and plains.

species-and-culture/species/dragonfolk.h.title: Dragonfolk
species-and-culture/species/dragonfolk.h.description:
Dragonfolk refers to a category of sophont species that have some relation -- whether in origin or appearance -- to the great dragons.
Dragonborn are dragonlike folk. They come from all the different Elemental Plains.
Kobolds are dragonlike folk, specifically from the Plain of Fire. Their relationship to dragons is tenuous beyond appearances.

species-and-culture/species/human.html.title: Human
species-and-culture/species/human.html.description:
Humans are Novelfolk that originate in Morshir. It is commonly believed that they were created by Soarkos soon after The Shaping.They appear in a variety of builds, height from 5-6 feet tall, eye colors from blue to green to brown, skin from dark to fair, and natural hair from blond to black. There are also two subspecies of humans: Aasimar and Genasi.
Aasimar are winged humans. Most attribute these wings as a blessing from Soarkos. This blessing appears seemingly at random, an aasimars wings manifesting when they come of age.
Genasi are humans who are somehow touched by the Elemental Plains, either through exposure to unstable elemental gates or some other form of elemental chaos. Some appear as regular humans, and others bear some mark of the Plain they were touched by.

species-and-culture/species/novelfolk.ht.title: Novelfolk
species-and-culture/species/novelfolk.ht.description:
Novelfolk refers to a category of sophont species that seemingly have no relation to the other creatures of nature.
Dwarves are novelfolk that originate in the Plain of Fire. They are often of stout build and on slightly short, usually 4-5 feet tall.
Elves are novelfolk that originate in the Plain of Earth. They are often tall and slender, usually 6-7 feet tall, and have pointed ears.
Fauns are novelfolk that originate in the Plain of Earth. They have the legs and ears of a goat, and often have horns and a tail.
Gnomes are novelfolk that originate in the Plain of Earth. They are a short people, usually 3-4 feet tall, and have pointed ears.
Goliaths are novelfolk that originate in the Plain of Fire. They are extremely tall, usually 7-8 feet, and sometimes have an unusual amount of eyes, between one and three.
Halflings are novelfolk that originate in the Plain of Earth. They are a short people, usually 3-4 feet tall, and have hairy feet. They also tend towards plumper builds.
(For more information, see: Human)
Humans are novelfolk that originate in Morshir. They come in a variety of heights and builds, and have a shorter lifespan than other folk.
Aasimar are winged humans.
Genasi are humans who are somehow touched by the Elemental Plains.
Tieflings are novelfolk that originate in the Plain of Fire. They come in a variety of heights and builds, and have horns and a tail.
Warforged are novelfolk that originate in Morshir. They are mechanical beings given the spark of life through magic. They come in various sizes and shapes.

index.html.title: Character Creation Guide
index.html.description:
They said that the Shattering was the end of the world. For you, it was only the beginning. Dear Players,If you are looking for help making your character, I'd recommend starting with the Class Guide for how each class could fit into the different factions of the world. Then, hop on over to Species and Culture for information on where your character could be from and how it shaped them. You can also browse the species that populate the world, although check with the GM, as some species may be off limits to players depending on game system.
Otherwise, feel free to start browsing the wiki with the in-universe Front PageSincerely, Your GM

introduction.html.title: Introduction
introduction.html.description:
The world of Morshir is vast and varied, even after the Shattering. From the Northern Hills, past Dragonclaw Isle, and down to New Saria, the peoples of the fallen Erkad Alliance have fought back the tides and survived, building a new one in its place. It has been a hard fought battle, and while much is left to do, the worse seems to be behind us.
This tome seeks to document what has survived and capture the memory of what has sunken below, from the Shaping of the World to our present era.The information I have gathered so far is divided into several categories for ease of use:
Geography and Politics for information on Morshir, its land and its nations
History and Legend for the storied past of this world
Religion and Deities for the Dragons and the institutions surrounding their worship
Species and Culture for the peoples inhabiting Morshir and their technologies There is much to learn within the pages of this tome, on a massive variety of topics. Because of this, it is not a book to read from cover to cover in one sitting. Rather, it is a book to reference when it is needed, so feel free to skip around and take things at your leisure.
< |

info_showDefaultFolderIcons.description: Show a default icon of a folder for every folder in the tree

info_showDefaultFileIcons.description: Show a default icon of a file for every file in the tree

info_defaultFolderIcon.description: The icon to use for folders. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultFileIcon.description: The icon to use for files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_defaultMediaIcon.description: The icon to use for media files. Prefix with 'lucide//' to use a Lucide icon

info_exposeStartingPath.description: Whether or not to show the current file in the file tree when the page is first loaded

info_showOrphanNodes.description: Show nodes that are not connected to any other nodes.

info_showAttachments.description: Show attachments like images and PDFs as nodes in the graph.

info_allowGlobalGraph.description: Allow the user to view the global graph of all nodes.

info_allowExpand.description: Allow the user to pop-out the graph view to take up the whole screen

info_attractionForce.description: How much should linked nodes attract each other? This will make the graph appear more clustered.

info_linkLength.description: How long should the links between nodes be? The shorter the links the more connected nodes will cluster together.

info_repulsionForce.description: How much should nodes repel each other? This will make disconnected parts more spread out.

info_centralForce.description: How much should nodes be attracted to the center? This will make the graph appear more dense and circular.

info_edgePruning.description: Edges with a length above this threshold will not be rendered, however they will still contribute to the simulation. This can help large tangled graphs look more organised. Hovering over a node will still display these links.

info_minNodeRadius.description: How small should the smallest nodes be? The smaller a node is the less it will attract other nodes.

info_maxNodeRadius.description: How large should the largest nodes be? Nodes are sized by how many links they have. The larger a node is the more it will attract other nodes. This can be used to create a good grouping around the most important nodes.

info_allowResizing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be resized

info_allowCollapsing.description: Whether or not to allow the sidebars to be collapsed

info_rightDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the right sidebar

info_leftDefaultWidth.description: The default width of the left sidebar

info_selector.description: CSS selector for an element. The feature will be placed relative to this element.

info_type.description: Will this feature be placed before, after, or inside (at the beggining or end).

info_featurePlacement.description: Where to place this feature on the page. (Relative to the selector)

info_sourcePath.description: The local path to the source .html file which will be included.

info_allowFoldingLists.description: Whether or not to allow lists to be folded

info_allowFoldingHeadings.description: Whether or not to allow headings to be folded

info_siteUrl.description: The url that this site will be hosted at

info_authorName.description: The name of the author of the site
